alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Wayne; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 7:19AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lawrence, Cabell, central Mingo, central Kanawha, southwestern Putnam, Lincoln, northwestern Raleigh, Wyoming, Logan, eastern Wayne and Boone Counties through 800 AM EDT... At 717 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Barboursville to 8 miles west of Burnwell. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Huntington, Nitro, Madison, Logan, Hamlin, Pineville, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Barboursville, Milton, Mullens, Chesapeake, Marmet, Oceana, Belle, and Chapmanville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 13 and 36, and between mile markers 50 and 55. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 76 and 95. Route 119 between Logan and Charleston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Wayne; Wyoming
